1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:

83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None

102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))

116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.

29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):

80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:

83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)

100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):

118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:

75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:

94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

1def _read(self, fp, fpname):
2        """Parse a sectioned configuration file.
3
4        Each section in a configuration file contains a header, indicated by
5        a name in square brackets (`[]'), plus key/value options, indicated by
6        `name' and `value' delimited with a specific substring (`=' or `:' by
7        default).
8
9        Values can span multiple lines, as long as they are indented deeper
10        than the first line of the value. Depending on the parser's mode, blank
11        lines may be treated as parts of multiline values or ignored.
12
13        Configuration files may include comments, prefixed by specific
14        characters (`#' and `;' by default). Comments may appear on their own
15        in an otherwise empty line or may be entered in lines holding values or
16        section names. Please note that comments get stripped off when reading configuration files.
17        """
18        elements_added = set()
19        cursect = None                        # None, or a dictionary
20        sectname = None
21        optname = None
22        lineno = 0
23        indent_level = 0
24        e = None                              # None, or an exception
25        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
26            comment_start = sys.maxsize
27            # strip inline comments
28            inline_prefixes = {p: -1 for p in self._inline_comment_prefixes}
29            while comment_start == sys.maxsize and inline_prefixes:
30                next_prefixes = {}
31                for prefix, index in inline_prefixes.items():
32                    index = line.find(prefix, index+1)
33                    if index == -1:
34                        continue
35                    next_prefixes[prefix] = index
36                    if index == 0 or (index > 0 and line[index-1].isspace()):
37                        comment_start = min(comment_start, index)
38                inline_prefixes = next_prefixes
39            # strip full line comments
40            for prefix in self._comment_prefixes:
41                if line.strip().startswith(prefix):
42                    comment_start = 0
43                    break
44            if comment_start == sys.maxsize:
45                comment_start = None
46            value = line[:comment_start].strip()
47            if not value:
48                if self._empty_lines_in_values:
49                    # add empty line to the value, but only if there was no
50                    # comment on the line
51                    if (comment_start is None and
52                        cursect is not None and
53                        optname and
54                        cursect[optname] is not None):
55                        cursect[optname].append('') # newlines added at join
56                else:
57                    # empty line marks end of value
58                    indent_level = sys.maxsize
59                continue
60            # continuation line?
61            first_nonspace = self.NONSPACECRE.search(line)
62            cur_indent_level = first_nonspace.start() if first_nonspace else 0
63            if (cursect is not None and optname and
64                cur_indent_level > indent_level):
65                cursect[optname].append(value)
66            # a section header or option header?
67            else:
68                indent_level = cur_indent_level
69                # is it a section header?
70                mo = self.SECTCRE.match(value)
71                if mo:
72                    sectname = mo.group('header')
73                    if sectname in self._sections:
74                        if self._strict and sectname in elements_added:
75                            raise DuplicateSectionError(sectname, fpname,
76                                                        lineno)
77                        cursect = self._sections[sectname]
78                        elements_added.add(sectname)
79                    elif sectname == self.default_section:
80                        cursect = self._defaults
81                    else:
82                        cursect = self._dict()
83                        self._sections[sectname] = cursect
84                        self._proxies[sectname] = SectionProxy(self, sectname)
85                        elements_added.add(sectname)
86                    # So sections can't start with a continuation line
87                    optname = None
88                # no section header in the file?
89                elif cursect is None:
90                    raise MissingSectionHeaderError(fpname, lineno, line)
91                # an option line?
92                else:
93                    mo = self._optcre.match(value)
94                    if mo:
95                        optname, vi, optval = mo.group('option', 'vi', 'value')
96                        if not optname:
97                            e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
98                        optname = self.optionxform(optname.rstrip())
99                        if (self._strict and
100                            (sectname, optname) in elements_added):
101                            raise DuplicateOptionError(sectname, optname,
102                                                       fpname, lineno)
103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e

103                        elements_added.add((sectname, optname))
104                        # This check is fine because the OPTCRE cannot
105                        # match if it would set optval to None
106                        if optval is not None:
107                            optval = optval.strip()
108                            cursect[optname] = [optval]
109                        else:
110                            # valueless option handling
111                            cursect[optname] = None
112                    else:
113                        # a non-fatal parsing error occurred. set up the
114                        # exception but keep going. the exception will be
115                        # raised at the end of the file and will contain a
116                        # list of all bogus lines
117                        e = self._handle_error(e, fpname, lineno, line)
118        self._join_multiline_values()
119        # if any parsing errors occurred, raise an exception
120        if e:
121            raise e
